page.title: 09HOUSES
page.content: There are lots of different types of houses in the block. The oldest houses are in the middle of the villages and close to the churches. The oldest are between 300 and 400 years old and the newest house, finished in May 1985, is in Fittleton. It is built in an orchard that once belonged to the Manor House. The materials used are chalk, flint, stone, brick and prefab-ricated panels. Some of the older houses are cruck built which gave more room inside. Roof materials include thatch, tiles and slate. The oldest houses in Figheldean are the Old Post Office and the Old Bakery which still has the ovens inside. There are terrace, semi-detached and detached houses and bungalows, very small and very large. Homes are both privately owned and rented.
